articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects KPA Unit 322
articles.content:
Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il inspected KPA Unit 322 honored with the title of O Jung Hup-led Seventh Regiment. 
					
					 He was accompanied by Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK, KPA Vice Marshal Ri Yong Ho, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and chief of the General Staff of the KPA, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC, Kim Kyong Ok, first vice department director of the C.C., the WPK, and KPA Generals Kim Myong Guk, Kim Won Hong, Pak Jae Gyong and Hyon Chol Hae. 
					
					 After receiving a salute, he went round combat and technical equipment to learn about the unit's training and regular combat preparedness. 
					
					 He praised the commanding officers of the unit for rounding off combat preparations in their field as required by the trend of the latest military science and technology and the mode of combat action. 
					
					 Only when soldiers prepare themselves well to go into action, can they wipe out enemies at a single blow no matter when they come in attack, he noted, adding that all the servicepersons of the KPA should think of combat preparations only awake or asleep, always use their brains, meditate and practice like the servicepersons of the unit. 
					
					 The socialist country is always invulnerable as it is guarded by such reliable soldiers as servicepersons of the unit who are fully ready to promptly carry out the combat order issued by the party and the country any time, he said. 
					
					 He met with the heroes of the DPRK who successfully performed their duties during the training. He had a photo session with them. 
					
					 He visited a sub-unit of the unit.
					
					 Pleased to see persimmons trees around the barracks heavily laden with fruits, he said the trees have good tenders and appreciated the servicepersons' sincerity.
					
					 Then he named it unit of Kamnamu (persimmon trees).
					
					 Dropping in at the education room, he acquainted himself with the political and ideological education among the soldiers. He stopped for a long while before the photos of the heroes produced by the unit and added shine to their exploits. Standing before an honor bulletin board, he carefully looked at the photos of the soldiers who distinguished themselves in the military and political trainings.
					
					 Looking round the daily provision store, he was satisfied with the soldiers' rich diet.
					
					 He once again highly praised the soldiers of the unit for following the moves of the enemies for aggression with vigilance and putting spurs to the training, always keeping themselves in high combat readiness.
					
					 He had a photo taken with the soldiers of the unit.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects Thaesong Machine Plant
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects Thaesong Machine Plant

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il provided field guidance to the Thaesong Machine Plant. 
					
					 He went round the room devoted to the education in the revolutionary history, conducted by leading officials of the plant. 
					
					 Stopping before the board bearing the proposition of President Kim Il Sung that the name of the DPRK should be engraved on the machines manufactured by the plant, he recollected with deep emotion the devoted efforts made by the President for the development of the plant.
					
					 After seeing data on labor innovators including winners of Order of Kim Il Sung and Kim Il Sung Youth Honor Prize and labor heroes, and February 16 Science and Technology Prize the plant received, he appreciated the plant's great contribution to the development of the nation's machine-building industry and scientific and technological development. 
					
					 Dropping in at the Machine Assembling Shop, he acquainted himself in detail with the production and scientific and technological researches there.
					
					 Watching new machines produced by the plant, he was greatly satisfied with the fact that the workers, scientists and technicians of the plant have successfully manufactured machines based on the latest science and technology capable of representing the Songun era by giving full play to the extraordinary creative spirit. 
					
					 Examining the newly researched and developed machine parts one by one, he praised the plant for successfully producing machine parts requiring high precision difficult to process.
					
					 Informed that the plant is successfully manufacturing machines of which it could hardly think in the past by putting all production processes on a CNC basis, he said that a high-pitched drive for putting production processes on a CNC basis is now under way in various parts of the country, bringing about world-startling achievements.
					
					 Learning about cultured practices in production and hygiene and supply service at the plant, he praised the plant for successfully managing and operating itself and providing good supply service for its workers in line with behests of the President.
					
					 The plant is an important machine producer as it is taking the lead in the drive to make the country richer and more prosperous, he said, setting forth important tasks facing the plant.
					
					  He was accompanied by Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK, KPA Vice Marshal Ri Yong Ho, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and chief of the General Staff of the KPA, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC, Pak To Chun, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, Kim Kyong Ok, first vice department director of the C.C., the WPK, and KPA Generals Kim Myong Guk, Kim Won Hong, Pak Jae Gyong and Hyon Chol Hae.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Italian Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Italian Delegation

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday had a talk with the Italian delegation of assemblymen from different political parties led by Mauro Del Vecchio, senator from the Democratic Party, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Dominican President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Dominican President

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greeting to Nicholas Liverpool, president of the Commonwealth of Dominica, on the 33rd anniversary of its independence.
					
					 Kim in the message wished the president success in his work for the country's socio-economic development and the friendly Dominican people progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il Meets New Nigerian Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Meets New Nigerian Ambassador

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Il, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Thursday had a talk with Maclean Igonikon Omuso, new Nigerian ambassador to the DPRK, who paid a courtesy call on him.

articles.title: Military Tie-up of US and S. Korea Flailed
articles.content:
Military Tie-up of US and S. Korea Flailed

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the National Peace Committee of Korea in a statement on Thursday denounced the U.S. and the south Korean puppet group for their military tie-up and war moves.
					
					 During his recent U.S junket, the south Korean chief executive visited the Defense Department and had a military confab. On Oct. 27 and 28 the U.S. and south Korean puppet warmongers held a meeting of the military committee and annual security consultative meeting in Seoul at which they talked about "U.S. forces' involvement in local war" and "tailored deterrence strategy". They are, at the same time, comprehensively supplementing and rounding off anti-north war scenarios as evidenced by their working out of a new joint operation plan to cope with someone's "start of a local war." 
					
					 They are staging war maneuvers for a war of aggression against the north almost everyday in Phohang, North Kyongsang Province and the areas close to the north including areas along the Military Demarcation Line and Paekryong Island, talking about Hoguk exercises and the like in a bid to put them into practice. 
					
					 They are stepping up the preparations for a war of aggression against the north. For instance, they are busy reorganizing and strengthening the combined control system of the U.S. forces and the puppet forces and handing over large quantities of U.S. latest war hardware to the puppet forces. 
					
					 Branding their military tie-up and war moves as the dangerous actions to wreck peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula, spark a new Cold War and arms race and ignite a war, the spokesman said:
					
					 It is nonsensical for the U.S. and the puppet forces to justify the above-said military nexus and war moves under the pretext of "provocations" from someone.
					
					 It is none other than the puppet group which sets up targets insulting the system and dignity of the DPRK and fires bullets and shells at them, seriously getting on its nerves and perpetrates such reckless provocations as scattering leaflets and airing conspiratorial broadcasting programs little short of war actions.
					
					 It is again the puppet group and the U.S. military bosses that are unhesitatingly letting loose a spate of provocative outbursts such as "air operation beyond air over the Military Demarcation Line" and "preemptive strike".
					
					 This being a hard reality, the U.S. and the puppet group are talking about "provocations" from someone and the like. This reminds one of the proverb: A thief crying "Stop the thief!"
					
					 Their ever-more tightened military nexus and intensified war moves go to prove that  "dialogue" and "peace" on their lips are hypocritical and they have only the ulterior intention to do harm to the other party. Their use of force would get them nowhere. They are sadly mistaken if they calculate they can browbeat the DPRK by recourse to force.
					
					  "Provocation" and "threat" are the stereotyped words used by aggressors when pulling up the other side.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK are fully ready for both local warfare and all-out war.
					
					 Its revolutionary forces will mercilessly smash such things as "tailored deterrence strategy" with the tremendous might of Songun.
					
					 The U.S. and the puppet group would be well advised to stop their foolish acts, bearing deep in mind the disastrous consequences to be entailed by the above-said reckless moves.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Univ. Delegation Leaves for China
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Univ. Delegation Leaves for China

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- A delegation of Kim Il Sung University led by its first Vice-President Kim Gyun left here Thursday to take part in the international academic seminar to be held at Beijing University of China.
					
					 A delegation of political officers of the Korean People's Army led by Col. General O Chol San returned home after winding up its visit to Vietnam on the same day.

articles.title: Letter of Thanks from Director General of ITAR-TASS
articles.content:
Letter of Thanks from Director General of ITAR-TASS

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a letter of thanks from V. N. Ignatenko, director general of ITAR-TASS of Russia, on Tuesday for his answers given to questions put by ITAR-TASS on Oct. 13.
					
					 The letter said:
					
					 We extend heartfelt thanks to you for our honor of receiving the answers you gave to questions put by ITAR-TASS as regards your successful visit to Siberian and Far Eastern regions of the Russian Federation. 
					
					 We take it as our honor that you let our news agency publish the contents of its interview with you and inform the Russian people of the most important news about your impressions of Russia visit, your appreciation of the successes made by the Russian government and people in building a powerful state, and the will of you, the great leader of the Korean people, to develop the tradition of the DPRK-Russia friendship.
					
					 The Russian readers had a growing interest in the principles of peace, friendship and goodwill of the DPRK's foreign policy.
					
					 We always remember President Kim Il Sung's aphorism "Believe in the people and rely on them and you shall always emerge victorious".
					
					 We are sure that your country will be built into a prosperous and powerful one in the near future thanks to the efforts made by you believing in the people and thinking about their future at all times.
					
					 The interview evoked a great echo among the Russian people and was made public through hundreds of mass media at home and abroad, thus turning into a great event of the public circles.
					
					 This is entirely the result of the long tradition of DPRK-Russia friendship as well as of the deep interest of the Russian government and people to strengthen the friendship and further develop the bilateral relations in political, economic, cultural, military and all other fields.
					
					 Expressing again thanks and best regards to Kim Jong Il, the director general in the letter heartily wished the Korean people peace and prosperity.

articles.title: Jagang Provincial Innovators Arrive in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Jagang Provincial Innovators Arrive in Pyongyang

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Officials, labor innovators, scientists and technicians of Jagang Province arrived here on Thursday to tour the capital city of Pyongyang at the invitation of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Pyongyangites warmly welcomed them, who performed admirable feats in the drive to realise CNC, on the route from the Pothongmun rotary to Pyongyang Koryo Hotel through the People's Palace of Culture and Pyongyang Railway Station where the buses carrying them passed. Among those welcoming crowd were officials of ministries and national institutions and working people from all walks of life.
					
					 When those innovators arrived at the hotel, their lodging, its employees gave warm welcome to them, putting bays on their necks and presenting bouquets.
					
					 Present there to greet them were Pak To Chun, secretary of the C.C., WPK, and other senior officials of the WPK Central Committee.
					
					 Meanwhile, the innovators of Jagang Province left Huichon City on the same day, getting hearty send-off from working people and school youth and children in the city.
					
					 Working people of different strata and school youth and children in the town of Hyangsan, North Phyongan Province, too, turned out to see off the ranks of those visitors.

articles.title: Italian Delegation Visits Kumsusan Memorial Palace
articles.content:
Italian Delegation Visits Kumsusan Memorial Palace

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Italian delegation of assemblymen from different political parties headed by Mauro Del Vecchio, senator from the Democratic Party of Italy, Thursday visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace to pay homage to President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The guests made a bow to the President in boundless reverence for him.
					
					 They made entries in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Concert for Solidarity with Cuba Held
articles.content:
Concert for Solidarity with Cuba Held

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- A concert for solidarity with Cuba was held here Thursday. It marks the month of international solidarity for the release of Cuban patriots and the cultural day of Cuba.
					
					 Present there on invitation were Ambassador German Hermin Ferras Alvarez and staff members of the Cuban embassy here.
					
					 So Ho Won, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, who is also vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Solidarity with Cuba, officials concerned and working people in Pyongyang were present there.
					
					 So Ho Won and German Hermin Ferras Alvarez made speeches.
					
					 They said that the concert is an expression of firm solidarity and support for the Cuban people waging a dynamic struggle to denounce the U.S. moves to isolate and stifle Cuba and for the release of Cuban patriots.
					
					 The concert was performed by the artistes of art groups in Pyongyang including the orchestra of the Yun I Sang Music Institute. Put on the stage were string quartets "February Is Spring" and "In My Life", sopranos "Oh, My Motherland of Songun" and "Cuba Yes, Yankee No" and other numbers.

articles.title: National Program Contest and Exhibition Closed
articles.content:
National Program Contest and Exhibition Closed

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The 22nd national program contest and exhibition was closed with due ceremony at the Three-Revolution Exhibition Thursday.
					
					 During the contest and exhibition opened on October 27, there were contests among such programs as English-Korean translation programs and computer simulation practice programs.
					
					 There were also IT exchange and program service.
					
					  In the computerization exhibition by ministries and national institutions the Ministry of Agriculture took the special place and Ministries of Land and Marine Transport, Public Health, Light Industry and Electric Power Industry, the Foreign Trade Bank, the State Commission for Quality Management and the Central Statistic Bureau the first place.
					
					 In the exhibition by industrial establishments the Pyongyang Textile Mill, the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex, the Central Information and Communication Centre, the Pyongyang Garment Factory, the Taean Friendship Glass Factory and the Nampho Glassware Branch Factory won good appraisal.
					
					 At least 200 programs presented by such units as Kim Il Sung University, Kim Chaek University of Technology, Huichon University of Technology and Mathematics Institute of the State Academy of Sciences were acclaimed in the section of program exhibition.
					
					 The first place in the contest of programs for translating English into Korean was taken by Kim Il Sung University, Kim Chaek University of Technology, Wonsan University of Fisheries and the Pyongyang Information Centre and that in the contest of programs for computer simulation practice by Kim Il Sung University.
					
					 Present at the closing ceremony were Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the Cabinet, Choe Hui Jong, department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Yong Jin, chairman of the Education Commission, officials concerned and programmers.

articles.title: DPRK Defeats Myanmar- U-19 Soccer
articles.content:
DPRK Defeats Myanmar- U-19 Soccer

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Preliminaries for the 2012 Asian U-19 Soccer Championships are taking place in Vietnam. 
					
					 The DPRK belongs to the Group F with Myanmar, Laos, Malaysia and Vietnam. 
					
					 The DPRK team defeated its Myanmar rival 2:0 on Wednesday. 
					
					 It will have a match with Lao team on Friday.

articles.title: Cotton Plucking Under Way in DPRK
articles.content:
Cotton Plucking Under Way in DPRK

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Cotton plucking is in full swing in co-op cotton farms throughout the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					
					 The Yangdong Co-op Cotton Farm in Unpha County and Songjuk Co-op Cotton Farm in Yonthan County, North Hwanghae Province, have a good crop of cotton though weather conditions were not favorable for cotton growing this year.
					
					 Cotton farms in Nampho City are bringing cotton processing in step with harvest.
					
					 Those in North and South Phyongan, Kangwon and South Hamgyong provinces have stored the harvested cotton in dry warehouses.

articles.title: Koryo Medicine Dispensary
articles.content:
Koryo Medicine Dispensary

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The Koryo Medicine Dispensary in Munsu Street, Pyongyang, draws many customers with the demand for Koryo medicine ever growing in the country.
					
					 The dispensary sells more than two hundred kinds of traditional medicines and dried herbs good for medical treatment and health promotion.
					
					 It also provides customers with prescriptions and usage of medicines.
					
					 Some of the Koryo medicines enjoy popularity in foreign markets.
					
					 Such dispensaries find themselves in all provinces, cities and counties of the country.

articles.title: Ri Jo Won, Celebrated Korean Wrestler
articles.content:
Ri Jo Won, Celebrated Korean Wrestler

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Ssirum (Korean wrestling) is one of the Korean people's traditional sports events.
					
					 There are many celebrated Korean wrestlers in the country. 
					
					Among them is Ri Jo Won, a 32-year-old student of Sinuiju University of Light Industry in North Phyongan Province. 
					
					 He is 1.86 meters tall and 102 kg heavy. 
					
					 Ri got married and has a son. 
					
					 He finished first and second three times respectively at the National Ssirum Tournament for Grand Bull Prize. 
					
					 He, born in Paekam County, Ryanggang Province, graduated from Paekam College of Agriculture and joined the April 25 Sports Team to learn ssirum.    
					
					 After leaving the sports team, he began working with the North Phyongan Provincial Supply Centre of Goods for Fishermen and took the title in a provincial ssirum tournament.
					
					 His diverse techniques, including a waist tackle, are admired by experts and spectators. 
					
					 The government gave him a new dwelling house for his brilliant results.

articles.title: Future of Humankind Is Guaranteed under Socialism
articles.content:
Future of Humankind Is Guaranteed under Socialism

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Socialism is greeting a new heyday after dealing a heavy blow to capitalism.
					
					 Historical turn has been made in which the scheme of the imperialists and reactionaries to stamp out socialism ended in smoke and socialism was revived and strengthened.
					
					 The red flag of socialism is firmly defended in Asian and Latin American countries including China, Vietnam, Laos and Cuba despite the imperialists' vicious challenge and disturbance.
					
					 More than 270 political parties have struggled to defend and advance the socialist cause under the banner of the Pyongyang Declaration.
					
					 Social conversion from capitalism to socialism is taking place in Latin America which suffered much more damage from the U.S.-style "globalization" than any other region. 
					
					 Progressive parties and personages have won in the elections to take power as they call for priority to the interests of the popular masses, not to those of a handful of the privileged circle, and independent development of their countries.
					
					 This is a political tendency rampant in not only Latin American countries such as Venezuela, Brazil, Nicaragua, Bolivia, Ecuador and Peru but the rest of the world. 
					
					 Shortly ago, Bolivian President Evo Morales said that capitalism is not able to solve the problems facing the mankind and the new century belongs to the peoples.
					
					 According to a poll made public by BBC of the UK, the majority of the respondents complained of the capitalist system based on free market economy while supporting the socialist idea.
					
					 Citizens of 15 countries involved in the poll demanded the nationalization of big businesses and the state control over the most of the stocks. This opinion was expressed most strongly by inhabitants in those countries where capitalism was restored, by 77% in Russia and 75% in Ukraine.
					
					 At a forum on "Future of capitalism" cosponsored by Japan's newspaper Asahi Shimbun and Tokyo University, Katsuto Iwai, professor of the Economy Faculty of Tokyo University, said: Socialism is no longer foe of capitalism. New foe is laissez-faire, the ideological viewpoint of capitalism.
					
					 Even though bourgeois reactionaries and their servants have got hell-bent on crackdown on the "Occupy Wall Street" demos by mobilizing mounted police and helicopters, the fighting spirit of the peoples in the demos to get rid of exploitation and oppression by capital is running higher.
					
					 The reality goes to prove that the more capitalism reveals its reactionary nature and weakness, the deeper the world people's trust in socialism grows.
					
					 Socialism gained rich experience and lessons in the course of going through painful setbacks and trials and is advancing full of vigor and energy on a broader and more solid class basis.
					
					 All the forces are aspiring after socialism, the forces that are opposed to war of aggression and advocate world peace, democracy, freedom, equality and justice and the forces that love countries and struggle to protect rights and interests of their peoples. 
					
					 The present era is that of historical turn in which the world people are dynamically advancing toward independence and socialism while capitalism is nearing its end.
					
					 Future of humankind depends on socialism as a science.

articles.title: S. Korean and US Armies Stage Military Exercises
articles.content:
S. Korean and US Armies Stage Military Exercises

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet forces and the U.S. imperialist aggression troops present in south Korea have staged in Phohang, North Kyongsang Province, a DPRK-targeted joint landing drill as part of Hoguk, large-scale joint military exercises.
					
					 Involved in the drill announced by the warmongers on Tuesday were troops of the 1st Division of the south Korean marine corps and tanks, armored cars, artillery pieces, helicopters and fighters and other huge armed forces.
					
					 It is aimed to occupy the depth of the coast they landed and ensure consecutive landing of their rear units.
					
					 This drill, kicked off on Oct. 28, will last till the last day of the Hoguk exercises after being expanded to division-level scale for the first time under the present "government" of south Korea.
					
					 Meanwhile the puppet 2nd Army Corps has been engaged in the rehearsal for attack on the DPRK in Hwachon of south Korean Kangwon Province with mobilization of its special warfare units since the start of the Hoguk exercises, which are going on across south Korea.

articles.title: S. Korean Army's Helicopter Crashes
articles.content:
S. Korean Army's Helicopter Crashes

					Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- A helicopter belonging to the Air Operation Command of the south Korean puppet army crashed on a hill of Wonju City, south Korean Kangwon Province on Wednesday, according to south Korean MBC.
					
					A pilot was killed in the accident.
					
					The helicopter was taking part in Hoguk exercises, a rehearsal for a war of aggression against the DPRK.

articles.title: S. Korean Military's Illegal Surveillance Accused
articles.content:
S. Korean Military's Illegal Surveillance Accused

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The deputy spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea issued a commentary on Nov. 1 to denounce the puppet military authorities for their illegal surveillance of civilians.
					
					 The Ministry of Defense on Oct. 31 announced the investigation results that the Defense Security Command's illegal surveillance of a professor at Chosun University was done by individuals, not on the order of the military, the commentary noted, adding:
					
					 It was revealed that the high-ranking officials of the military held an emergency measure meeting to destroy evidence related to this illegal surveillance. This fact goes to clearly prove how deceptive the investigation results are.
					
					 We cannot remain an onlooker to the fact that the military's surveillance of civilians, which could be seen in the past period of the military dictatorship, has revived under the rule of the present authorities.
					
					 This case should not be left to the mercy of the military only, the commentary said, stressing the need to mobilize all means to make a thorough-going investigation into it.

articles.title: Stern Punishment of GI Criminals Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Stern Punishment of GI Criminals Demanded in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- A deputy spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea in a commentary Tuesday demanded stern punishment of the GI criminals in south Korea.
					
					 That day the court authorities reduced the prison terms imposed on a GI criminal who committed sexual assault on a teenage girl student in Tongduchon, Kyonggi Province, the commentary charged, saying:
					
					 This is an unreasonable judgment in disregard of the people's sentiment against the U.S.
					
					 Criminals should be sternly punished and the biased SOFA with the U.S. totally revised to eradicate the crimes by the U.S. forces present in south Korea.

articles.title: Attempt to Conclude FTA Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Attempt to Conclude FTA Protested in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Civic and social organizations of south Korea held a candlelight rally in Seoul Monday in protest against the conclusion of the FTA with the U.S. Among them was the Headquarters of the All-People Movement for Checking the Conclusion of the south Korea-U.S. FTA
					
					 Speakers at the rally accused the "Grand National Party" of working hard to get the FTA ratified.
					
					  All south Koreans have turned out to check the conclusion of FTA, rejecting it as "second Ulsa (1905) Five-point Treaty", they noted.
					
					 Now is the time to punish the GNP, they said, expressing the will to hold in check the conclusion of the humiliating agreement through action.
					
					 A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party in a commentary Tuesday slashed at the dictatorial deed of the GNP seeking to conclude the FTA with the U.S.

articles.title: Conspiracy for Military Tie-up Flailed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Conspiracy for Military Tie-up Flailed in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea released a commentary on October 30 in denunciation of the U.S.-south Korea annual security consultative meeting aimed at strengthening their military tie-up.
					
					 The military authorities of south Korea and the U.S. held an annual security consultative meeting in Seoul on October 28 at which they agreed to form a combined defense council.
					
					 The formation of this council, which is to embrace all meetings dealing with military affairs, will result in deepened dependence of south Korea on the U.S. in military field since the latter seizes a wartime operational control at present.
					
					 At the consultative meeting the warmongers agreed to strengthen the capability for joint counteraction against "local war provocation" by someone, thus further strengthening the U.S. military domination and interference in south Korea.
					
					 Worse still, they were seeking to expand the sphere of their military nexus even to outer space. In this case the U.S. will hold a dominant position in military strength by realizing the weaponization of outer space with south Korean resources.
					
					 The meeting also discussed such matters as developing the extended deterrence policy committee, which will bring a nuclear war crisis to the Korean Peninsula, and shifting on south Korea the burden of expenses for transfer of the U.S. military base.
					
					 Recalling the facts, the commentary said the meeting was for threatening peace on the Korean Peninsula and further pressuring the DPRK through strengthened alliance for aggression.
					
					 The authorities of south Korea and the U.S. should stop such act of going against the trend of peace and come out for the conclusion of treaty for peace on the Korean Peninsula and the withdrawal of the U.S. forces from south Korea, it held.

articles.title: DPRK Supported by Personages of Guinea and Sweden
articles.content:
DPRK Supported by Personages of Guinea and Sweden

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Personages of friendly organizations of Guinea and Sweden made public statements on Oct. 23 and 26 as regards the answers General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave to questions put by ITAR-TASS of Russia. 
					
					 Noting that the answers deeply moved him, Banou Keita, chairman of the Guinea-Korea Friendship Association, said in his statement:
					
					 The nuclear threat has not decreased, but is increasing in the Korean Peninsula day by day.
					
					 Recognizing that it was quite just for the Korean people to acquire nuclear deterrent for defending their sovereignty under such situation, we fully support the principled stand of the DPRK toward the nuclear issue of the Korean Peninsula and the resumption of the six-party talks. 
					
					 We strongly urge the U.S. not to drive the situation into the dangerous line by intensifying pressure upon the DPRK but drop its hostile policy towards the DPRK and opt for improving the relations with it. 
					
					 Christer Lundgren, chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association, said that the answers prove again that the DPRK sincerely hopes for normalized relations with its surrounding countries and stability of the Korean Peninsula and strives to create conditions for peaceful construction of the country. -0-

articles.title: Personages of Finland and Italy on Kim Jong Il’s Answers
articles.content:
Personages of Finland and Italy on Kim Jong Il’s Answers

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Personages of Finland and Italy issued statements on Oct. 28 and 29 as regards the answers General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave to questions by ITAR-TASS of Russia.
					
					 Antti Sika Aho, chairman of the Finnish Mangyongdae Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung, said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, made clear the stand on the prospect of development of the traditional DPRK-Russia relations, the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula, the resumption of the six-party talks and the prospect of the DPRK's relations with the U.S. and Japan.
					
					 He is a great master of diplomacy who has displayed distinguished ability in consolidating global peace, stability and friendship as well as DPRK-Russia friendship through his energetic external activities.
					
					 General Secretary Mauro Cazadio and Organizational Secretary Sergio Carraro of the Struggle for the Peace and Socialism of Italy in a joint statement said, referring to the contents of Kim Jong Il's answers on the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula and the resumption of the six-party talks:
					
					 The U.S. should stop the anachronistic and reckless hostile policy towards the DPRK and the war provocation moves, resume the six-party talks without precondition and honestly implement its duty under the Sept. 19 joint statement on the principle of simultaneous actions, thus promptly coming out for the denuclearization of the whole Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Larijani: Clinton Is Using Diplomacy as Toy
articles.content:
Larijani: Clinton Is Using Diplomacy as Toy

					 Tehran, November 2 (KCNA) -- Iranian Majlis Speaker Ali Larijani strongly denounced the recent anti-Iran remarks of U.S. Secretary of States Hillary Clinton and said she was mistaking diplomacy with a toy. 
					
					 He said this, addressing the parliament's Sunday morning session.
					
					 Terming as baseless the claims by Clinton regarding the opening of a virtual embassy for Iran, he said such remarks were worthless adding that events were underway in America today which would reveal its terrorist nature more than ever before.

articles.title: Iranian FM Criticizes US Troop Buildup in Middle East
articles.content:
Iranian FM Criticizes US Troop Buildup in Middle East

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Iranian Foreign Minister Ali-Akbar Salehi in a press conference during his visit to Iraq on Monday scathingly rejected the U.S. moves to increase armed forces.
					
					 The U.S. is planning to increase military presence in the Middle East under the pretext of military cooperation after the U.S. troop withdrawal from Iraq, he charged.
					
					 Rejecting interference of outsiders in Iraq, he stressed that the Iraqis know better than anybody else how to run their country.

articles.title: South Africa's Efforts to Develop National Industry
articles.content:
South Africa's Efforts to Develop National Industry

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- South Africa is striving to develop the national industry.
					
					 By signing a local procurement accord in Pretoria, the South African government, business, labor and community bodies committed themselves to increasing the number of goods and services bought locally to 75 percent, the South African Press Association (SAPA) reported on Monday.

articles.title: Cooperation among Different Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Different Countries

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- China and Laos on Oct. 31 signed an agreement to jointly build another cross-border nature reserve in order to better protect the endangered Asian elephant.
					
					 Vietnam and Kazakhstan agreed to expand cooperative relations in the fields of trade and investment on the same day.

articles.title: Iran Increases Defense Capability
articles.content:
Iran Increases Defense Capability

					 Tehran, November 2 (KCNA) -- Iran is exerting big efforts to increasing defense capability.
					
					 The minister of Defence and Armed Forces Logistics of Iran in an interview with IRNA on Oct. 29 said that Iran's experts are pushing forward the joint manufacturing of new type fighters with the air force.
					
					 New submarine furnished with high maneuverability and latest armed equipment will be deployed in the navy in the near future, he noted.

articles.title: Natural Disasters Expand in US, Vietnam
articles.content:
Natural Disasters Expand in US, Vietnam

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Heavy rains hit provinces of the Mekong delta in Vietnam, causing flood damage.
					
					 The flood left 58 people dead and over 930 kilometers of road, 823 bridges, 1,500 kilometer-long waterway and irrigation facilities were destroyed as of Oct. 31.
					
					 The damages accounted for about 71.4 millions U.S. dollars.
					
					 The damage caused by the snowstorm out of season in the northeastern area of the United States is on the steady increase.
					
					Snow was about 70 centimeters high in the northern part of New Jersey State and snow in Massachusetts and Pennsylvania States was more than 30 centimeters high.
					
					 Tremendous snowfall accompanied by violent wind left 12 dead as of Tuesday.
					
					Roads and railways were destroyed and air flights suspended. As a consequence, a lot of people were stranded.
					
					A state of emergency was declared in 13 counties of some states including Connecticut and New York States and at least 2 million houses in the northern part of Maryland State and Massachusetts State are left without power.
					
					 It would take about a week to put the situation under control and this heavy snow out of season is the first time in more than one hundred years of history of meteorological observation, VOA reported.

articles.title: US Drone Strike Kills 4 in Pakistan
articles.content:
US Drone Strike Kills 4 in Pakistan

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The U.S. forces in Afghanistan are committing ceaseless air raids on Pakistan under the pretext of "anti-terrorism".
					
					 A U.S. drone strike killed at least four people in Pakistan's North Waziristan tribal region Monday night, local media reported.
					
					 The spy aircraft fired four missiles on a compound and a vehicle at Naurak, a small town some 15 kilometers from Miranshah, the center of North Waziristan.

articles.title: Italy's Jobless Rate Rises
articles.content:
Italy's Jobless Rate Rises

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The number of unemployed totaled 2.08 million in Italy in September, 3.8 percent higher than in August, according to the data published by the National Statistics Agency Istat on Oct. 30.

articles.title: Russian FM Warns US and NATO against MD Deployment
articles.content:
Russian FM Warns US and NATO against MD Deployment

					 Moscow, November 2 (KCNA) -- Sergei Lavrov, foreign minister of Russia, in a statement on Nov. 1 warned the United States and NATO against the moves to deploy the missile defense system in Europe.
					
					 The talks still remain deadlocked between Russia and the U.S. and NATO to provide a legal guarantee that MD in Europe is not aimed at Russia, the statement said.
					
					 Such being a hard reality, the U.S. signed an agreement on deploying MD with Romania, it said, stressing: If the U.S. and NATO continue ignoring the view of Russia, it will take self-defensive step.

articles.title: Cuba Accuses US of Funding "Subversions"
articles.content:
Cuba Accuses US of Funding "Subversions"

					 Havana, November 2 (KCNA) -- Cuba on Monday accused the U.S. Agency for International Development of paying 3.4 million U.S. dollars for "operations of subversion" in the country. "In the midst of an economic crisis, when thousands of U.S. citizens are living in precarious conditions because of the loss of work and homes, this contribution to the so-called Foundation for Human Rights in Cuba (FHRC) takes place," said the official Granma daily.
					
					 It said the FHRC is a branch of the Cuban American National Foundation (CANF), an organization involved in planning acts of "terrorism" against the Caribbean nation, and added that the "terrorist nature" of the CANF has been proven by declassified documents.

articles.title: US Air Force Base to Close in 2014: Kyrgyz PM
articles.content:
US Air Force Base to Close in 2014: Kyrgyz PM

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The Kyrgyz prime minister in a press conference on Tuesday reiterated the stand of the government calling for the dismantlement of the Manas base of the U.S. air force. 
					
					 He said he was not sure that the presence of the American Transit Center in Kyrgyzstan provided total security.
					
					 "I warned U.S. embassy officials last year that the United States would have to close its base in 2014 in accordance with its obligations," he recalled.

articles.title: Jordan and UAE Welcome Palestinian UNESCO Membership
articles.content:
Jordan and UAE Welcome Palestinian UNESCO Membership

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The lower house of Jordan's parliament on Tuesday welcomed the decision by the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) to grant the Palestinians a full membership in the organization.
					
					 The lower house commended the countries that voted for the Palestinian membership in the organization. It reiterated support for the Palestinians and their efforts to realize their legitimate rights.
					
					 It also condemned a decision by the United States to halt funding for UNESCO as a punishment for its decision. 
					
					The United Arab Emirates' Minister of State for Foreign Affairs Anwar Mohammed Gargash welcomed Tuesday the Palestinians' accession to the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) as a full member.
					
					 UAE congratulates the Palestinian people and their leaders on the historic achievement, which is one of the positive steps that set the Palestinian state in its natural place in the international arena, he noted.
					
					 The Palestinians' accession to the UNESCO is the result of conscious diplomacy adopted by the Palestinian National Authority, he said.
					
					 He expressed the wish for building on this positive step to consolidate the legitimate role of the Palestinian state in the international arena.

articles.title: Israel Harms Peace by Withholding Money: PNA
articles.content:
Israel Harms Peace by Withholding Money: PNA

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Israel's decision to temporarily withhold money from transferring to the Palestinian National Authority (PNA) harms peace, the Palestinian presidency said Tuesday.
					
					 "Freezing the PNA's money is a provocation to our people and a theft of our money," said Nabil Abu Rdineh, spokesman for President Mahmoud Abbas, adding that it also "accelerates the destruction of the peace process."
					
					 Israel decided to suspend transferring millions of Shekels it levies on behalf of the PNA as custom revenues. This was in response to Monday's admission of the Palestinians as a full member in the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO).
					
					 Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu also ordered to build 2,000 new houses for Jews in East Kuds.

articles.title: Delegates to Party Congress to Be Selected in China
articles.content:
Delegates to Party Congress to Be Selected in China

					 Beijing, November 2 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CPC) recently issued a notice concerning the selection of delegates to the 18th CPC Congress.
					
					 The notice said the number of the delegates will be 2,270 selected from 40 electoral districts throughout the country.
					
					 The selection work will go on till late June next year, according to the notice.

articles.title: Japanese PM Urged Not to Follow US
articles.content:
Japanese PM Urged Not to Follow US

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Ex-Japanese Prime Minister Yukio Hatoyama on October 27 urged the present chief executive not to blindly follow the United States in negotiations.   
					
					 Japan should not cater to the U.S. demand in negotiations for conclusion of a Pacific basin economic solidarity agreement, Hatoyama said.

articles.title: Palestine Joins UNESCO
articles.content:
Palestine Joins UNESCO

					Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Palestine has become a member nation of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO).
					
					The UN agency admitted Palestine's membership through a voting on October 31.

articles.title: Russia Strengthens Anti-Crime Campaign
articles.content:
Russia Strengthens Anti-Crime Campaign

					 Moscow, November 2 (KCNA) -- Russia has paid much effort to strengthening the anti-crime campaign. 
					
					 The Russian Ministry of Interior recently revealed that more than 131,000 cases of illegal business activities were exposed in the country during the first nine months of this year.

articles.title: Ukraine's Legislator Critical of European Parliament's Resolution
articles.content:
Ukraine's Legislator Critical of European Parliament's Resolution

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The top Ukrainian legislator criticized the European Parliament's resolution on his country.
					
					 The European Parliament in a recent resolution said it would "develop neighborly-nation policy with Ukraine". 
					
					 During his visit to a province of the country on October 28, Vladimir Lytvyn, president of the Supreme Council, said the term "neighborly-nation policy" has proved insignificant.
					
					 Branding the resolution as harsh and contradictory, he called it "carrot and stick".

articles.title: Tajikistan, Belarus Agree to Develop Bilateral Cooperation
articles.content:
Tajikistan, Belarus Agree to Develop Bilateral Cooperation

					Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The presidents of Tajikistan and Belarus issued a joint statement in Dushanbe on October 28, expressing their willingness to develop cooperation between two countries.
					
					The statement stressed the need to develop bilateral cooperation within the framework of the Commonwealth of Independent States, Collective Security Treaty Organization, Shanghai Cooperation Organization and other international and regional organizations.

articles.title: Chinese Media Urged to Widely Introduce Spirit of Party Plenum
articles.content:
Chinese Media Urged to Widely Introduce Spirit of Party Plenum

					 Beijing, November 2 (KCNA) -- A national meeting of press officials was held in Beijing recently.
					
					 Addressing an opening ceremony, Li Changchun, a member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China (CPC), said mass media should regard it as their primary political task to study, introduce and implement the spirit of the 6th Plenum of the 17th CPC Central Committee.
					
					 Through this work they should encourage all the party members and ethnic groups to unite in the spirit of the plenum and concentrate wisdom and effort on implementing its decision, Li added.

articles.title: Kyrgyzstan to Develop Ties with Russia
articles.content:
Kyrgyzstan to Develop Ties with Russia

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The first vice-premier of Kyrgyzstan recently voiced his government's willingness to continue developing partnership with Russia.
					
					 In a press interview, the senior official quoted a recent poll result as saying that 97 percent of the Kyrgyz people favor expanded cooperation with Russia.
					
					 As Russia is a guarantor of peace and stability in the region, it is important for Kyrgyzstan to develop relations with the country, the official said.

articles.title: China Urges IAEA to Take Fair Position on Iranian Issue
articles.content:
China Urges IAEA to Take Fair Position on Iranian Issue

					 Beijing, November 2 (KCNA) -- A Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson clarified the country's stand to promote a solution to Iran's nuclear issue through diplomatic negotiations.
					
					 Speaking at a press conference on Oct. 28, Jiang Yu said China and Russia presented their views of Iran's nuclear issue to the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA).
					
					 China expressed the hope that the IAEA will take an objective and fair position and carefully prepare a report on the nuclear issue on the basis of facts, she added.

articles.title: Int'l Community Urged to Ensure Women's Rights
articles.content:
Int'l Community Urged to Ensure Women's Rights

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- China's permanent representative to UN called on the international community to ensure women's rights and interests.
					
					 Speaking at a recent meeting of the UN Security Council, the Chinese official underscored the need to avert war and armed conflict in order to decrease women's damage.  
					
					 To this end, the UN should promote peaceful solutions to disputes through dialogue and negotiations, the official said.

articles.title: China Urges UN to Keep Budget Rational
articles.content:
China Urges UN to Keep Budget Rational

					 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- China's deputy permanent representative recently called upon UN to keep its budget rational and reasonable.
					
					 Speaking at a debate on the 2012-2013 UN budget, the Chinese official said UN should make a budget to suit the present situation in which the international community is facing a challenge of global economic and financial crisis, with the capacity of the member nations, particularly developing nations put into consideration.
					
					 China hopes that UN will fix a rational and reasonable budget through serious and full discussions of the member nations, the official added.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige ejercicios de unidad combinada de fuerzas aereas
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige ejercicios de unidad combinada de fuerzas aereas

					Pyongyang, 3 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio los ejercicios de la unidad combinada de las fuerzas aereas del EPC que obtuvo el titulo de Septimo Regimiento de O Jung Hup.
					
					  Le acompanaron el vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del PTC Kim Jong Un, el vicemariscal del EPC Ri Yong Ho, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del PTC y jefe del Estado Mayor General del EPC, la miembro del BP y jefa de departamento del CC del PTC Kim Kyong Hui, el miembro suplente del BP del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional Jang Song Thaek, el miembro suplente del BP y secretario del CC del PTC Pak To Chun, el primer subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC Kim Kyong Ok y los generales de ejercito del EPC Kim Myong Guk, Kim Won Hong, Pak Jae Gyong y Hyon Chol Hae.
					
					 El Dirigente fue acogido por el general de ejercito dl EPC Ri Pyong Chol, comandante de las fuerzas aereas del EPC, el teniente general del EPC Son Chong Nam y otros generales y comandantes de la citada unidad.
					
					  Tras recibir el saludo de la guardia de honor el Dirigente reconocio al Heroe de la Republica Ho Ryong entre los comandantes y volvio a elogiar su valiente accion de combate, con la cual rechazo el avion de reconocimiento estrategico de los imperialistas norteamericanos invadido en el espacio aereo jurisdiccional de la patria.
					
					  Despues de conocer del estado de cumplimiento de guardia avanzada de la unidad, el Dirigente subio al puesto de mando, donde vio los ejercicios de vuelo de los pilotos que demostraron osadamente el poderio de las fuerzas aereas.
					
					  El expreso gran satisfaccion de que todos los pilotos, conscientes de que el entrenamiento es tambien el combate, hayan realizado activamente los ejercicios de vuelo para ser competentes aviadores de combate y felicito los exitos de entrenamiento de ellos.
					
					  Dijo que nuestros orgullosos pilotos son fuertes en la idea y la conviccion llenos de coraje de defender a ultranza el sagrado cielo de la patria socialista y prosiguio que es tan solido como muralla de acero el cielo de la patria defendido por las fuerzas aereas confiables.
					
					  El mismo dia, el Dirigente se reunio con 14 pilotos de la Unidad 447 de las fuerzas aereas del EPC quienes cumplieron magnificamente el dificil deber combativo de vuelo y se fotografio junto a ellos.
					
					  Elogio altamente que la unidad cumple responsablemente la guardia avanzada sin relajar la tension de combate observando atentamente las maniobras agresivas de los enemigos y estimulo a los militares.
					
					  El Dirigente tomo fotografia junto a los militares de la unidad.
					
					  El Dirigente, informado de que no llegaron los pilotos que realizaron los ejercicios de vuelo, espero hasta que ellos llegaran.
					
					  Al distinguir a los aviadores en la plataforma para tomar foto, les llamo y felicito por sus exitos de entrenamiento.
					
					 Y a ellos que le deseaban buena salud en el largo camino de la direccion sobre el terreno el Dirigente tambien les encomendo encarecidamente la salud y exitos en el entrenamiento.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Commonwealth de Dominica
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Commonwealth de Dominica

					Pyongyang, 3 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 3 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de Commonwealth de Dominica, Nicholas Liverpool, con motivo del 33o aniversario de la independencia de este pais.
					
					 El remitente desea al destinatario los exitos en su trabajo para el desarrollo socio-economico del pais y al pueblo amistoso el progreso y la prosperidad.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe carta de agradecimiento de V. N. Ignatenko
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe carta de agradecimiento de V. N. Ignatenko

					Pyongyang, 3 de noviembre (ACNC) -- En relacion con que el Dirigente Kim Jong Il dio el 13 de octubre las respuestas al cuestionario escrito de la agencia noticiera de Rusia ITAR-TASS, V. N. Ignatenko, director general de la mencionada agencia le dirigio una carta de agradecimiento que sigue:
					
					Le enviamos a usted el sincero agradecimiento de que nos dio las respuestas al cuestionario escrito de la agencia noticiera rusa ITAR-TASS sobre su exitosa visita a las regiones de Siberia y Lejano Oriente de Rusia.
					
					Consideramos orgullosos de que usted hizo que nuestra agencia publicara el contenido de las respuestas, y diera a conocer al pueblo ruso las informaciones importantes relacionadas con la impresion de su visita a Rusia y su evaluacion sobre  los exitos logrados por el gobierno y el pueblo de Rusia en la construccion del poderoso Estado y la voluntad de usted, gran Dirigente del pueblo coreano, de desarrollar la tradicion de amistad Rusia-Corea.
					
					Los lectores rusos tenian el gran interes en los principios de la paz, la amistad y la buena voluntad de la politica exterior de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					Nunca olvidamos las palabras celebres del gran Lider, camarada Kim Il Sung de que si uno confia y apoya en el pueblo, saldra siempre victorioso.
					
					Estamos convencidos de que gracias a los esfuerzos de Ud. quien siempre confia en el pueblo y piensa en el porvenir de este, la RPDC levantara en un futuro  cercano el Estado prospero.
					
					Las respuestas de usted causaron repercusiones explosiva entre el pueblo ruso y se ha hecho un gran acontecimiento del circulo social al ser publicadas a traves de centenares de medios de prensa masiva en el interior y el exterior.
					
					Todo esto se debe enteramente al resultado de la larga tradicion de amistad Corea-Rusia y de la gran atencion del gobierno y el pueblo rusos de intensificar esta amistad y desarrollar mas las relaciones bilaterales en todos los dominios de la politica, economia, cultura y asuntos militares.  
					
					El director general volvio a expresar al Dirigente su agradecimiento y homenaje y deseo sinceramente que el pueblo coreano obtenga la paz y la prosperidad.

articles.title: RPDC ofrece concierto de solidaridad con Cuba
articles.content:
RPDC ofrece concierto de solidaridad con Cuba

					Pyongyang, 3 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar hoy en esta capital el concierto de solidaridad con Cuba con motivo del mes de solidaridad internacional por liberar a los 5 patriotas cubanos y el dia de cultura de este pais caribeno.
					
					Fueron invitados el embajador German Hermin Ferras Alvarez y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica cubana acreditados en Corea.
					
					Estuvieron presentes el vicepresidente del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero y del Comite Coreano de Solidaridad con Cuba, So Ho Won, y otros funcionarios coreanos junto con los trabajadores capitalinos.
					
					So Ho Won y el embajador cubano mencionaron que Destacaron que el concierto es la expresion de firme solidaridad y  apoyo al pueblo cubano que denuncia las maniobras de aislamiento y aplastamiento de Estados Unidos a Cuba y libra con vigor la lucha por liberar a los  patriotas cubanos.
					
					Los artistas de la orquesta del Instituto de Musica Yun I Sang y otras entidades artisticas centrales pusieron en la escena el cuarteto de instrumento de cuerda "Febrero es la primavera" y " En el camino de mi vida", el soprano "Mi patria del Shogun", "Cuba si, Yanqui no", etc.
